multimonster.common.plugin
Interface Pluggable

All Superinterfaces:
SettingListener
All Known Subinterfaces:
TransporterFacade
All Known Implementing Classes:
TransporterImplBean
public interface Pluggable
extends SettingListener

In normal cases the managing class of an component, like resourcemanager or transporter, implements the Pluggable interface, so the component is enabled to be extended with plugins

Author:
Holger Velke (sihovelk)

Method Summary
 void addPlugIn(PlugInInformation plugInInformation)
          addPlugin is called when an new PlugIn is inserted in the system or if a released plugin in reattached.
 void releasePlugIn(PlugInIdentifier plugInId)
          releasePlugIn is called if a PlugIn is removed but the settings of the plugin are keept in the system.
 void removePlugIn(PlugInIdentifier plugInId)
          removePlugIn is called if a plugin is removed and the settings of the plugin are not keept in the system.
 
Methods inherited from interface multimonster.common.setting.SettingListener
changeSetting
 

Method Detail

addPlugIn

public void addPlugIn(PlugInInformation plugInInformation)
addPlugin is called when an new PlugIn is inserted in the system or if a released plugin in reattached.

Parameters:
plugInInformation - containing the plugin-specific information and the plugin-id

releasePlugIn

public void releasePlugIn(PlugInIdentifier plugInId)
releasePlugIn is called if a PlugIn is removed but the settings of the plugin are keept in the system.

Parameters:
plugInId - the ID of the released plugin

removePlugIn

public void removePlugIn(PlugInIdentifier plugInId)
removePlugIn is called if a plugin is removed and the settings of the plugin are not keept in the system.

Parameters:
plugInId - the ID of the removed plugin
